chapter.title: Test Page Printing
chapter.para: The queues are saved when finishing the printer module. When testing printer, only the queue being tested is saved. The names of these saved queues are y2test, or y2testNUMBER (first free number is found in order to avoid collision of queue names). The problem may occur when tested queue is somehow connected to other queue that hasn't been saved yet (eg. create a queue A and then create a queue B which will be a network queue forwarding jobs to the queue A of the local host which hasn't been saved.
After a queue is saved, the test page is prepared. There are two kinds of test pages: ASCII test page and PostScript test page.

section.title: ASCII Test Page
section.para: There is no need to update the ASCII test page before being printed. It is just passed to the spooler.

section.title: PostScript Test Page
section.para: There are two possibilities how to print the PostScript test page: With a high color photography and without it. The reason is that some PostScript printers may fail printing this high color photography without the job being processed by ghostscript.

Before the test page is printed, the graphics and texts are patched into it via an external script. The graphics contain the vendor logo and a photo for testing photographic printing. Texts contain all texts in the test page (so that the page can be localized). Currently, only ASCII and ISO-8859-1|2|15 encodings are supported. The queue name, printer vendor and model, PPD file nick name, printer URI, location description, information and options as adjusted in the PPD file are patched to the test page too.
